content:
Pokud je v tom HTML hlavička, tak tam dodat nebo změnit charset. Příklad: <meta charset="UTF-8"> Nebo starší zápis: <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8">

Více o tom zde: Diakritika na HTML stránkách.

content: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1445521 Note: the config editor setting is only for new folders created. For existing folders, you need to use the sample instructions to follow.
creator: davidsk

content:
Here is official info: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird The link also explains how to use config editor so that all future folders you create are unthreaded.

On your question: - set one folder to your preferences and highlight it - click the icon on right side of the menu bar of message list pane as shown on web page - click to apply current view to> and highlight 'folder and subfolders and PAUSE - a menu opens to left with account name. highlight that and PAUSE - another menu opens to its left with account name at top. CLICK THERE and a confirmation message will appear to confirm setting all folders in the account.
creator: davidsk

content:
That's brilliant David

It was the menu bar setting. It wasn't showing up on the right.

All sorted now

content: You cannot change an IMAP account to a POP account. Assuming that the frontier account works with Yahoo, stead, create a fresh account for POP and then you can delete the unwanted IMAP account.
creator: davidsk

content: For IMAP accounts, nothing is lost. For POP, all is lost unless you had a backup.
creator: davidsk

creator: robgru

content: excuse my ignorance
creator: robgru

content: Sorry, I was focused on 'clean install'. If thunderbird was not running during the backup, all should be there. The layout would have been c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird. If you can recover the thunderbird folder, you have everything. Then, install thunderbird and exit. Next, copy that thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming. That will overlay the default thunderbird folder and you will have everything.
creator: davidsk
